abstract: Macquarie Bank and its partners said shareholders owning 36 percent of Qantas Airways, Australia’s largest airline, have agreed to their A$11.1 billion ($9.1 billion) takeover offer, due to expire Friday. The buyout will fail unless the group reaches 50 percent by 7 p.m. in Sydney Friday. The bidders held about 33 percent of the airline yesterday, they said in a statement.
lead_paragraph: Macquarie Bank and its partners said shareholders owning 36 percent of Qantas Airways, Australia’s largest airline, have agreed to their A$11.1 billion ($9.1 billion) takeover offer, due to expire Friday. The buyout will fail unless the group reaches 50 percent by 7 p.m. in Sydney Friday. The bidders held about 33 percent of the airline yesterday, they said in a statement.

headline.main: Qantas Buyout Comes Down to the Wire
